name: Mushroom Masala
history: Mushroom Masala is a popular dish in Indian cuisine, especially among vegetarians. It consists of mushrooms cooked in a spicy and creamy gravy, often flavored with various Indian spices, tomatoes, and onions.
description: Mushroom Masala is a flavorful Indian curry made with mushrooms simmered in a rich and spicy tomato-based sauce. The dish is enhanced with traditional Indian spices, making it a delightful vegetarian option that pairs well with rice or bread.

instructions.title: SautÃ© the Aromatics
instructions.description: Heat oil in a frying pan. Add cumin seeds and let them splutter. SautÃ© onions and green chilies until the onions turn golden. Add ginger-garlic paste and cook for a minute.

instructions.title: Add Spices and Tomatoes
instructions.description: Stir in turmeric, red chili, and coriander powder. Add pureed tomatoes and cook until the oil separates from the masala.

instructions.title: Cook the Mushrooms
instructions.description: Add the sliced mushrooms and salt. Cook until the mushrooms are soft and have released their water.

instructions.title: Final Touches
instructions.description: Sprinkle garam masala and add cream if using. Cook for another 2-3 minutes.

instructions.title: Serve
instructions.description: Garnish with chopped coriander leaves. Serve hot with naan, roti, or rice.

tips: Clean the mushrooms properly before slicing them.
Adjust the spice levels according to your preference.
variations: Add green peas or bell peppers for more color and nutrition.
For a vegan version, skip the cream or use coconut milk.

storage.shelfLife: Can be refrigerated for up to 2 days.
storage.instructions: Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator.

reheatingInstructions: Reheat in a microwave or on a stove until hot.
presentationTips: Serve in a bowl with a side of freshly sliced onions and lemon wedges.
Garnish with cream and a sprig of fresh mint for a refreshing touch.
